assessment.title: Anatomy and Direction of the Lymphatic Organs

body.p: What lymphatic organ is inferior to the thymus?

multiple_choice.choice: The thymus is the most inferior lymph organ.

response.feedback: Not quite. Lymph nodes are found throughout the body; some are superior to the thymus and some are inferior.
Correct. The thymus is near the neck, and the spleen is in the abdomen. This means that the spleen is inferior to the thymus.
Incorrect. The tonsils are superior to the thymus.
Incorrect. The thymus lies posterior to the upper portion of the sternum, near the neck. It is superior to an organ listed.

no_response.feedback: Please try to answer the question.

part.hint: The organ you are asked to identify is the largest organ in the lymphatic and immune systems.
